task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 209°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, but the top is currently cut off, so I will look up.
I have been rotated away from the target building; I need to turn back to the specified heading of approximately 209° to reacquire the target.
I am facing the correct building again, but the top is cut off, so I need to tilt my view upwards to see the entire structure for a height estimation.
The system has incorrectly reset my heading to 0° North again; I must rotate back to the target building at 209° South-West to continue my assessment.
I am correctly oriented towards the target building, but I cannot see its full height, so I must tilt my view upwards to see the roof.
My heading has been reset to 0° again after I tried to look up; I will rotate back to the target building at 209° and try a different approach to see the full height.
Since looking up seems to cause a system error, I will try moving further away from the building to get a better view of its full height.
I have moved further away from the building, and now I need to turn back to face it at approximately 209° to get a full view.

I can now see the entire building from this new position; I will count the floors to estimate the height, which appears to be about 8 stories high, and at an average of 3.5 meters per story, that's approximately 28 meters.
